definition: ox/cow/bull/CL:條|条[tiao2],頭|头[tou2]/newton (abbr. for 牛頓|牛顿[niu2 dun4])/(slang) awesome
angle/corner/horn/horn-shaped/unit of money equal to 0.1 yuan, or 10 cents (a dime)/CL:個|个[ge4]
role (theater)/to compete/ancient three legged wine vessel/third note of pentatonic scale
lit. to penetrate into a bull's horn (idiom); fig. to waste time on an insoluble or insignificant problem/to bash one's head against a brick wall/a wild goose chase/a blind alley/to split hairs
lit. to hang one's books on cow horns (idiom)/fig. to be diligent in one's studies
lit. honing a bull's horn; fig. to waste time on an insoluble or insignificant problem/to bash one's head against a brick wall/a wild goose chase/a blind alley/to split hairs/same as idiom 鑽牛角尖|钻牛角尖

sentences.english: You may wonder why having a horn cut off requires anaesthetics.
sentences.chinese: 你可能會覺得奇怪，爲什麼去掉牛角需要麻醉？

sentences.english: Advice is not for the knowledge of knowledge, into a dead end.
sentences.chinese: 建議就是不要爲了知識而知識，鑽牛角尖。

sentences.english: Don't be too single-minded. It will only serve to bind you later on.
sentences.chinese: 別太鑽牛角尖，這隻會成爲你日後的羈絆。

sentences.english: Marion uses the screen to curl to the elbow and wait for the ball.
sentences.chinese: 馬里昂利用掩護卷切到牛角區等球。

sentences.english: Huodataidu on porphyrin As for the Horn into a blind alley or.
sentences.chinese: 豁達大度，就卟至於轉入死衚衕或牛角尖。

sentences.english: The decoration in Jono chinese-western restaurant is vogue and contracted, where the environment is full of bourgeoisie feeling.
sentences.chinese: 金牛角王的裝修時尚而簡約，環境充滿小資情調。

sentences.english: In France, the fighter tries to pick a ribbon from the horns of the bull.
sentences.chinese: 在法國，鬥牛士極力取下牛角上的綢帶。

sentences.english: Rhinoceros horns are in great demand for use in medicines and as tops for knives.
sentences.chinese: 犀牛角可用於製造藥物和刀柄，需求量很大。

sentences.english: And Li Mi hung his book on a horn of his cow and made time to read it.
sentences.chinese: 隋朝的李密把書掛在牛角上，一有時間就讀。

sentences.english: She is typically shown with the face of a woman and the ears and horns of a cow.
sentences.chinese: 她通常是擁有女性的臉孔及牛耳和牛角。

sentences.english: Ongoing from that was a phase of a propensity for depression, for compulsion, for paranoia.
sentences.chinese: 那的確是一段抑鬱，容易偏執鑽牛角尖的日子。

sentences.english: The fact that you want to do better with your time means you’re stuck as-is.
sentences.chinese: 事實上你想做得更好意味着你已被卡住，鑽牛角尖了。

sentences.english: Does not overanalyze negative points, but instead looks for the positive points in the subject being analyzed.
sentences.chinese: 不會鑽牛角尖過度悲觀，能看到事物積極的一面。

sentences.english: 12A customs officer stands guard over seized rhino horns in Hong Kong.
sentences.chinese: 一名香港海關人員正守護在被查獲的犀牛角旁。

sentences.english: It is said to be rhinoceros horn, wonder what should a rhinoceros horn like?
sentences.chinese: 有人說是犀角，不知犀牛角應該是個什麼樣子？

definition: variant of 榔頭|榔头[lang2 tou5]
sheep's head/fig. advertisement for good meat
horse's head/same as 碼頭|码头[ma3 tou2], pier
both ends/both parties to a deal
Ox-Head, one of the two guardians of the underworld in Chinese mythology
